intro: Coleataenia anceps, commonly known as the African orchid, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features tall, erect stems with showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its blooms are often clustered in racemes, adding a dramatic visual impact to its appearance. Coleataenia anceps is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
